p: On 11 March 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the coronavirus disease, namely COVID-19, a pandemic and the scientific community shifted its focus towards this fight. Today, there is no proven effective and specific treatment for COVID-19. However, a sign of the extraordinary commitment carried out by researchers around the world is provided by recently published scientific evidences. Suffice it to say that the word “SARS-CoV-2” is reported on PubMed in 45,860 scientific articles, with reference date as the end of December 2020, demonstrating how the scientific community has conducted intensive research on this emergent topic. However, it is also well known that the development of specific de-novo antiviral therapies generally takes from 10 to 17 years, while for particular vaccine production it should be necessary to wait for a timeframe of approximately 12–18 months.
